param.name: composeApplicationDescription
param.para: The that describes the compose application to be created.

summary.para: Creates and instantiates the Service Fabric compose application described by the compose application description.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The create application request is not valid with respect to the provisioned manifests for the requested application type.
: The application name is not a valid Naming URI.
: A corrupted file was encountered on the image store.
: The compose application has already been created.
: The application has already been created so that compose application can not be created using the same name.
There was an error accessing a file on the Image Store.
A required file was not found .
A path to an Image Store file/directory was too long.
: There was an IO error communicating with the Image Store.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeleteComposeApplicationAsync (this System.Fabric.FabricClient.ApplicationManagementClient client, Uri applicationName);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Threading.Tasks.Task DeleteComposeApplicationAsync(class System.Fabric.FabricClient/ApplicationManagementClient client, class System.Uri applicationName) cil managed

param.name: applicationName
param.para: The URI of the application instance name.

summary.para: Deletes the compose application instance from the cluster.

remarks.para: All application state will be lost and cannot be recovered after the application is deleted.

exception.para: The object is in a closed state. Dispose of the object you are using and instantiate a new object.
: The application does not exist.
: The application is being upgraded.
The request timed out but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.
The request was canceled before the timeout expired but may have already been accepted for processing by the system.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Preview.Client.Query.ComposeApplicationStatusList> GetComposeApplicationStatusPagedListAsync (this System.Fabric.FabricClient.QueryClient client, Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Preview.Client.Description.ComposeApplicationStatusQueryDescription composeApplicationQueryDescription);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Preview.Client.Query.ComposeApplicationStatusList> GetComposeApplicationStatusPagedListAsync(class System.Fabric.FabricClient/QueryClient client, class Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Preview.Client.Description.ComposeApplicationStatusQueryDescription composeApplicationQueryDescription) cil managed

param.name: composeApplicationQueryDescription
param.para: The that determines which compose applications should be queried.

summary.para: Gets the status of compose applications created that match filters specified in query description (if any). If the compose applications do not fit in a page, one page of results is returned as well as a continuation token which can be used to get the next page.

returns.para: A that represents the asynchronous query operation. The value of TResult parameter is an that represents the list of compose applications that respect the filters in the and fit the page. If the provided query description has no matching compose applications, it will return a list of 0 entries.

exception.para: See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See for handling common FabricClient failures.
See also for handling common FabricClient failures.
